unnormalised: Planning a trip within India? Figuring out which airline to fly with can be a bit of a task, especially with so many options vying for your attention. Let's take a look at some of the big players in Indian airways. After all, chutti is coming up!

unnormalised: First up, we've got Indigo. They're practically synonymous with domestic flights in India. Known for their punctuality (most of the time, anyway!), Indigo boasts a huge fleet and a vast network connecting major cities and smaller towns. Think Delhi to Mumbai for Rs. 3500 or Guwahati to Kolkata for Rs. 2800. You can usually find a flight every couple of hours. Plus, their website is pretty user-friendly.

Plus, their website is pretty user-friendly.

unnormalised: SpiceJet is another budget-friendly option. They often have promotions and discounts, making them a popular choice for students and budget travelers. SpiceJet flies to a lot of tier-2 and tier-3 cities, which can be super convenient if you're heading off the beaten path. Just keep in mind that sometimes, their timings can be a bit... flexible.

unnormalised: Vistara aims for a more premium experience. It's a joint venture between Tata Sons and Singapore Airlines. They offer a more comfortable journey with extra legroom and better in-flight services. If you're looking to treat yourself, or if you've got a long flight ahead, Vistara might be worth the splurge. They often fly from Delhi to Bangalore at 7:00 AM and 9:00 AM.

unnormalised: When choosing an airline, don't forget to compare baggage allowances, cancellation policies, and onboard services. Some airlines charge extra for everything from seat selection to meals. Always read the fine print before you book. Booking 2 months in advance always gives you the best prices, usually.
